    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseAccessObject

        public DatabaseAccessObject(DatabaseRepresentation db)
        This is a parent class to all the Access Classes. It contains general sql commands which all the Access classes will inherit.

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> get(java.lang.String table,
                                                 java.lang.String whereStatements)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Abstract get sql function which returns an object(s) in a table
        Parameters:
        db - A DatabaseRepresentation object
        conn - A database connection
        table - The table in which to search
        whereStatements - Should be a string prepared to be inserted just after the where portion of the statement. Ex. "ID = \"394729383\" AND Name = \"Henry\""
        Returns:
        An array of objects from the table searched
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • update

        public java.lang.Boolean update(java.lang.String table,
                                java.lang.String whereStatements,
                                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> valueNames,
                                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> values)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Abstract update sql function
        Parameters:
        table - The table in which the object will be found
        whereStatements - Any limitations in the search
        valueNames - A list of the names of each column for the object to be updated
        values - The new values to be added for each column listed in valueNames
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • add

        public java.lang.String add(java.lang.String table,
                            java.lang.String valueNames,
                            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> values)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Abstract insert sql function
        Parameters:
        table - The table in which the object will be added
        valueNames - The names of each column to be added in the database. Must correspond to the database columns for the table indicated
        values - The values to be added for each of the columns listed in valueNames
        Returns:
        The object in memory representing the record just added in the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
